intro: Valerianella microcarpa var. puberula, commonly known as velvetleaf valerian, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely hairy, ovate leaves that give it a velvety texture. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Valerianella microcarpa var. puberula is an annual herb that is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
